No family should ever have to choose between putting food on the table and getting the health care they need. 

Enhanced Premium Tax Credits have allowed thousands of Coloradans to access affordable coverage, but if Congress lets them expire, too many will be forced off their plans and left without the care they need.

We need a permanent fix, and we need it now. I urge my Republican colleagues to work with us to ensure families don't have their care ripped away.
Shana Tova, Colorado! Wishing you all a sweet and joyful Rosh Hashanah. May the new year be filled with hope, renewal, and apples & honey. https://t.co/HYtTG85RjA

This man is utterly unhinged.

TLDR: Trump wants a government shutdown. He'd rather hurt the American people than work with Democrats to find a way forward to fund critical services & stop health care costs from skyrocketing. https://t.co/JNLoVgQILk

Colorado family budgets are feeling the squeeze & the cost of groceries, gas, & everything in between keep going up. 

Trump promised to lower costs on day one. Unsurprisingly, that was just another lie. Now, families in CO are stuck footing the bill. 

He has always only cared about millionaires & billionaires -- not you.
https://t.co/CGh6VySfks

Trump said he would cut “fraud, waste, and abuse” within our government, but instead, he’s helping his billionaire allies cheat our tax system.

The IRS is not Trump’s political arm. The fraud, waste, and abuse is coming from inside the White House.
https://t.co/xMWWhbTrGg https://t.co/dkUMA3WBtO

From rising food prices to cuts to Medicaid, SNAP, and HUD, the city of Broomfield & the Broomfield chamber of commerce are tackling these challenges daily. I'm grateful for their work supporting families & stepping up when our community needs it most. I’ll always fight for their priorities in Congress, even when Trump works to dismantle the programs so many people in our community rely on.

Trump is throwing our service members under the bus—all to fuel his revenge tour against anyone who disagrees with him.

We love our mail-in voting system here in Colorado. Let me be clear: we don’t bend the knee to Trump. That’s not who we are or what we do in Colorado.
https://t.co/LfEBqRSGYX

In CO, wildfires have become a year-round threat. And Jeffco has some of the highest risks in the state. I’m grateful to the leadership of the sheriff’s office and the county in using innovation & every tool to identify & respond rapidly to save lives & homes. 

I’m thankful for the work they do every day & the opportunity to give updates on what we’re doing in Congress to support their work. But also the increased risks we’re facing because of Trump’s devastating budget cuts.

Exciting to see “A Place for Kids” break ground in Cripple Creek. In a community where child care is hard to come by, this is a vital step to ensuring every family has access to the care they need.

I'm fighting for $1 million in federal funding for this project because investing in child care is the best investment we can make in our economy & the next generation.
https://t.co/ithpbMSa5Y

I joined reporters and media leaders at the National Federation of Press Women’s Conference because their role couldn’t be more important in ensuring we continue to have a free press and a resilient democracy. 

Supporting a free and fair press that can continue to tell the stories that matter most should be a top priority for all, especially as Trump threatens our democracy and targets women journalists with sexist attacks designed to silence them.

No one should be surprised that our adversaries are trying to exploit our divisions — spreading lies and conspiracies after Charlie Kirk’s murder to inflame more tensions between us.

But instead of strengthening our defenses, Trump shut down the Global Engagement Center that normally flags these foreign disinformation campaigns. He’s leaving us vulnerable while our adversaries do his bidding.

There are many things that keep me up these days, but this brings an entirely different level of gravity to our situation. The President of the US is saying that they should consider denying contracts of media companies through the FCC if they have anti-Trump messages.

This is GOVERNMENT CENSORSHIP. This is antithetical to our constitution and the founding of our country. This is absolutely fucking terrifying.

Coloradans are being squeezed by rising costs because of Trump’s disastrous economic policies and this funding bill does nothing to meet the economic and health care needs of the American people – and that’s before the tsunami hits from Trump’s Big Ugly Bill.

Once again, we are facing a looming shutdown because of the chaos and dysfunction of the Republican majority. I continue to be so deeply disappointed as an American and as a member of this body.
My full statement on Republicans’ cynical ploy to divide the country around the rise in political violence and the assassination of Charlie Kirk. ⬇️ https://t.co/08Dz4B6Pxi

Nobody should be killed for their beliefs – that is not who we are as a country. 

That’s why @RepVeasey and I are introducing legislation to unequivocally condemn ALL acts of political violence & call on our colleagues to come together to build the future our kids deserve.

Charlie Kirk’s death is tragic, but instead of uniting our country to stand against the rise in ALL political violence, Trump is using this moment to target the people who disagree with him, including using the FCC Chair to threaten media companies unless they fire or muzzle reporters and commentators. First it was Stephen Colbert, now it’s Jimmy Kimmel. Who’s next? This is exactly what the first amendment was designed to prevent.

I just got done speaking on the House floor following the horrific events of last week in my community at Evergreen High School and the rise of political violence nationally. We face a choice at this moment, and I want to personally ask my colleagues to join me in actually doing something about it.

Watch my full remarks ⬇️

Our state stands to lose $500 million in revenue thanks to Trump’s tariff tirade. People’s livelihoods are at stake & far too many businesses are at risk of going bankrupt.

Large corporations can weather the storm of these tariffs but it’s our small businesses that are going to pay the biggest price. 

We have to rein in his power. All we need is a handful of Republicans to join us in signing our discharge petition to force a vote & hold him accountable. 
https://t.co/csFNNlTDWj

My mom struggled with an opioid addiction for decades that eventually led to heroin & fentanyl. She’s one of the lucky ones — she got the care she needed to rebuild her life.

But too many families are still being torn apart by this crisis. That’s why I introduced bipartisan legislation to designate a Fentanyl Prevention & Awareness Day so we can raise awareness, expand treatment, & save the lives of people like my mom. 
https://t.co/YatFwI305f

Stopping & arresting people based on how they look isn't about safety. It's just racist - plain & simple. 

The fact that SCOTUS is green-lighting Trump's anti-immigrant agenda is despicable. 

I'm joining my colleagues in calling on @SecretaryNoem  to give us answers. This absolutely violates our constitution & we deserve accountability.

Trump and the Republicans are figuring out what we all already knew - the Big Ugly Bill is bad for Americans and deeply unpopular. 

Trying to rebrand this disastrous bill isn't going to change anything. Trump might be a conman but he won't be able to con his way out of the pain & suffering that's going to hit families.

Naloxone saves lives — and knowing how to use it can mean everything in a moment of crisis. My mom wouldn't be alive today without this overdose reversal drug. 

Grateful to join the Bipartisan Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Task Force’s Naloxone Training to help equip staff with the knowledge needed to reverse an overdose.

Our schools are supposed to be a safe place – one where we should be able to drop our kids off without worrying if we will see them again. Unfortunately, that is far from our reality in the US and what happened at Evergreen High School is every parent’s worst nightmare

I’m grateful to my colleagues for joining this resolution to condemn these violent attacks while also recognizing the people who exemplify the best of us.

Wishing the happiest of birthdays to my best friend and husband, Ian. Davis and Sam are so lucky to have you as their father and I’m grateful every day for the life we’ve built. Thank you for being our rock and for being on this adventure with me. Looking forward to many more. https://t.co/4EcDJaq3FT

An 80-year-old was conned out of nearly $6,700 by a scammer on a dating app. This type of fraud is shameful & should be preventable.

Stories like this aren’t rare. That’s why I introduced legislation to hold platforms accountable & require basic safeguards that protect users. No one should lose their savings because of bad actors who these companies refuse to stop.
https://t.co/Ks84OAFMBQ

We’ve finally seen a reduction in overdose deaths in CO, including a 35% reduction in fentanyl deaths in the last year alone. But Trump’s OBBB is going to decimate the progress we’ve made to ensure that those who want help have access to the treatment they need.

That’s why I’m working on a bill to ensure CO & the 37 other states who followed our lead can continue to use Medicaid to cover substance use disorder treatment. It is a disease that requires medical care.

Not having a reliable supply of diapers can impact everything, from a kid's health & safety to a parent's ability to go to work every day. 1 in 2 families have difficulty paying for diapers. In Colorado I was able to pass the first ever funding at the state level for diaper banks, a change that we are working on nationwide. 

Such an honor to join @DiaperNetwork  & highlight this urgent issue ahead of National Diaper Need Awareness week. It's so important to ensure every family has access to the diapers they need to keep their children dry, clean, and healthy.

I joined over 2,000 people from across our community and state to come together & support the victims, students, families, & educators who faced this horrific tragedy. While this is a heavy time, being there made me feel an overwhelming sense of gratitude for the community & hope for our future. 

Hearing about the teachers who threw themselves in front of students, the first responders who showed up in two minutes & did everything they were trained to do to save countless lives, and the neighbors who opened their doors to students who they hid in the basement to keep safe. 

I don’t want to remember the gunman, I want to remember our heroes who are reflective of who we are. I know that there’s a long road to recovery & we want you to know that we are here to support you in any way that we can. Here’s a list of resources for those who need it:

I found out about the horrific tragedy at Evergreen High School just moments after learning that Charlie Kirk was assassinated.

We have to ask ourselves – do we want to live in a country where our kids are being gunned down in their classrooms? Where your life hangs in the balance at a grocery store, a movie theater, or a political rally?

We can't continue to let our kids, teachers, & communities pay the price for failed policy and inaction. Together we can build the future our children deserve – but only if our leaders have the courage to do something & decide this isn't who we want to be.

Today we remember the lives lost on September 11, 2001, and the ways our nation was forever changed. The pain of that day is still felt by families, survivors, and all of us who continue to carry their memory. 

We honor the nearly 3,000 innocent people and the first responders who showed unimaginable courage. As we grieve, we also carry forward the lessons of unity, compassion, and community that emerged in the days after 9/11 — a reminder of the true strength of the American spirit.

I’m grateful for the brave Jeffco law enforcement officers whose quick response undoubtedly saved lives. But I’m also outraged. Our kids, our teachers, and our communities continue to pay the price for failed policy and failed leadership. This was preventable. And it’s inconceivable that we are here again.

How much do we need to lose before we are willing to say enough? Our kids deserve so much better. (3/3)

Just like every parent reading the headline, I felt the shock and terror of today and thought: what if that was my kid? What if that was his school?

I can only imagine what the families, students, and educators are going through right now. Please know that we are here to support you in every way we can. But we owe you more than support. We owe you more than condolences. We owe you a future where our kids are safe. (2/3)

I know our state and our community are shocked and terrified. Children were dropped off at school this morning — a place that should be safe — only to face unimaginable tragedy. My heart breaks for the students who are fighting for their lives in the hospital, the parents who are at their bedside not knowing if they will ever come home, and for the kids and teachers who will carry the trauma of this day forever. (1/3)

I know our state and community are rattled and anxiously waiting for updates on the tragic shooting at Evergreen High School. @jeffcosheriffco is providing updates. We will continue sharing resources and information as we get them.

It's becoming too common for people to be violently targeted because of who they are or what they believe. Let me clear - ANY political violence is completely unacceptable.

We have to unequivocally denounce it & put a stop to it immediately.

Shocked & heartbroken to see there is an ongoing incident involving an active assailant at Evergreen High School. I'm hopeful that law enforcement is able to intervene & ensure all of our kids come home safe.

We are in communication with local law officials & will be there to support the Evergreen community.

I lost my older brother, Justin to suicide. That painful loss never leaves our family and we think about him every day. I share our story so others who have lost loved ones or are struggling themselves know they are not alone.

On #WorldSuicidePreventionDay, we must talk about how critical access to mental health support is and reduce the stigma surrounding those who are facing difficult times.

If you or someone you love is battling depression, please know that help is just a phone call away - dial 988 to connect to someone who cares.

Thoughts & prayers alone aren't going to end the epidemic of gun violence. 

As a mom, I cannot even fathom the anguish & heartbreak of parents who will never see their kids again. 

I'm demanding @speakerjohnson  do more to prevent these tragedies so our kids can grow up in a world where they're safe in schools, movie theaters, & public spaces.

Our office can help you renew your passport, answer questions, & make sure you’re ready for upcoming international travel. At our recent passport fair, my team helped 137 community members get the support they needed — whether for a vacation, a work trip, or anything else taking them abroad.

Before you pack your bags, make sure your passport is up to date & remember, our office is here to help if you need it.

The House Republicans just passed on of the most anti-environmental bills in U.S. history.

These 69 anti-environmental provisions won’t just hurt our planet — they will cause irreparable damage to our Colorado families.

From eliminating the EV tax credit to gutting climate disaster relief and slashing nearly 10,000 jobs, this bill is devastating. This will be detrimental to our health, as well as our economy.

As a mom, I'm constantly thinking about the future of our country & our democracy. Trump continues to threaten the very ideals that define our nation — from attacking our voting system, our institutions and trying to silence the press - there couldn’t be more at stake to protect our freedoms.

But it's people like those in @LWV  who give me hope that we are not going to back down, and together, we will get through this. Thank you for inviting me to speak — keep showing up and speaking out.

Today is the second annual 988 Suicide & Crisis Hotline Day - a reminder that help is always just a call or message away.

Just know - you are never alone. And you never have to face a mental health crisis by yourself.
https://t.co/B8lLnc6wwS

Let's set the record straight — vaccines did not kill more Americans than COVID-19. And no, Anti-depressants do not cause gun violence. 

This anti-science agenda is downright dangerous. https://t.co/HfVJywpO1j

I hear every day from families in CO & across the country that the rising costs of housing is their number one concern. Far too many people are being pushed out of the communities they grew up in and the communities they love because they can no longer afford to live there anymore.

Thank you to @RepJimmyGomez  for inviting me to speak at the National Summit on the Housing Affordability Crisis. We need bold solutions to this crisis. 

I'll keep using my position on the YIMBY & Real Estate Caucus to fight to lower costs & deliver solutions so more people can unlock homeownership and live in the neighborhoods they want to call home.

Colorado families are already paying the price for Trump’s reckless tariffs.

One homeowner told me they had to pay $1,400–$2,800 more on a $9,400 water heater — just because imported parts now cost more.

Tariffs are nothing more than a hidden tax on working families, and every day they make life more expensive.

Have you felt the impact of Trump’s trade war? Share your story on my website. ⬇️
https://t.co/lbnTKENVim

An error by Social Security caused Anette Falvo of Golden weeks of stress and a $31,000 loss from her late mother’s account. After countless calls and paperwork, she turned to my office in Lakewood for help. 

We were able to recover the funds fully, easing a huge burden during an already painful time for Anette.

Every day we’re helping Coloradans cut through red tape and get the answers and benefits that they deserve.

While Trump pushes harmful policies that threaten working families & cuts the critical support they need to keep a roof over people’s heads, the incredible team at Foothills Housing Authority continues to show up every single day to expand access to affordable housing.

I was honored to present them with an official recognition of their work in the Congressional Record — a small but meaningful way to recognize the life-changing work they do for families across our community. Their dedication reminds us what true public service looks like.

When a veteran in our community, Mr. Raul Fernandez, faced an urgent challenge with the @deptvetaffairs, my casework team stepped in to help. Thanks to their speedy work, we were able to bring relief to Mr. Fernandez and his family. 

My office is here to make sure our government always works for you, and especially those who have given so much for our country. If you need help, please don't hesitate to contact my office at 303.274.7944.

. @thecotableorg has been on the frontlines providing emergency food assistance in the metro area & now they’re expanding to meet the moment as Trump’s Big Ugly Bill threatens communities.

With demand rising & SNAP cuts looming, families will be pushed into impossible situations. I’ll keep working with organizations doing the work on the ground & fighting to ensure they have the resources needed to support Coloradans because no family should ever have to worry about their kids going hungry.

There's a lot of bad news out there right now but there are so many places that give me hope for the future. And Habitat for Humanity’s Griffith Station Homes is one of those bright lights.

This new housing construction is an example of what’s possible when local leaders prioritize housing and work alongside federal programs and nonprofits to make a project like this possible. We know that far too many Coloradans are unable to afford a roof over their head and homeownership seems like an impossible dream. In order to build financial stability for our families and communities, we must all work together to drastically increase our housing supply and ensure that people can stay in the places they love. 

Thanks to @habitat_org  for changing lives.

Hate has no place in our community. In Park County, a driver plowed into peaceful protesters speaking out against this lawless administration. Thankfully no one was hurt — but it's still deeply concerning to see a disturbing rise in political violence across the country, including CO. We must unequivocally condemn this hate wherever we see it.

Exciting news!🥳

My office has already returned $5 million in federal benefits back to families and businesses in CO-07. Our government should always work for you – not the other way around. 

If you or someone you know is having trouble with a federal agency, reach out to my office!
https://t.co/myJAGRlj2z

Like so many families, my family has been impacted by the opioid epidemic. Time and time again, my mom ended up in the emergency room from overdosing & was never discharged with naloxone.

My mom just celebrated 8 years in recovery & is only alive today because of the first responders who administered overdose-reversal drugs. That’s why I’m proud to introduce the HANDS Act with @RepJenKiggans  to ensure everyone has access to this life-saving treatment when they need it the most.

Grateful to join The Colorado Business Roundtable to hear more about the challenges facing our business community here in CO – from Trump's reckless tariffs, to immigration policies that are driving up costs & straining our workforce.

I’ll always support policies that help our economy thrive & make our workforce even stronger. I will continue to fight back against his disastrous policies that are hurting families, weakening our small businesses, & bringing global instability.

Thanks to Coors for hosting us and being an important part of Golden and Colorado’s economy.

I heard directly from the staff & seniors at Western Hills nursing home where 60% of residents rely on Medicaid. Most residents said that if Medicaid was no longer able to pay for their residency, they would have nowhere else to go. 

Trump's Big Ugly Bill will rip billions of dollars out of Colorado’s health care system - meaning deep cuts to critical services like our nursing homes. None of us will be left without feeling the impact but I am most worried for our seniors, people with disabilities and children. 

These are our parents & grandparents who are all at risk now. It's just shameful.

Annie Farmer. Anouska De Georgiou. Jess Michaels.

These are the names of just a few of the survivors who are here in DC, bravely telling their stories after enduring unimaginable abuse at the hands of Epstein & other powerful men.

Trump wants to silence them. We won't let them be erased, they deserve justice. And now.

We only need a few Republicans to join us & do the right thing.

School is back in session across Colorado including at @COschoolofMines! I had the chance to meet with faculty & leadership to discuss the difficulty they are facing with funding cuts to higher education and the unlawful withholding of funds to their institution for critical research. 

Mines’ is building the next generation of innovators to meet our most urgent challenges, alongside providing groundbreaking research. We can’t allow these cuts to jeopardize the future we want to build and the people who we need to make it happen.

Trump said he wouldn’t cut Medicaid. That was a lie. And now he’s coming for Medicare.

That means seniors forced to skip prescriptions, rural hospitals shutting their doors, & nursing homes struggling to keep their lights on.

It’s unfathomable that our seniors who have worked their whole lives are being left behind so Trump can hand out more tax breaks to some of the wealthiest people in the world.

More distractions & more lies. Colorado has one of the most safe & secure voting systems in the country. It means our seniors, veterans, & rural communities can access the ballot box. This is political retribution because Coloradans don’t like Trump — and that makes me proud.

This decision undermines our national security and operational readiness at a time when the United States should be demonstrating global leadership. Our adversaries are watching.

It’s also a blatant waste of taxpayer dollars. The rightful home of Space Command has been & always will be Colorado.

We will continue to fight this every step of the way to protect the service members and employees who live and work here.

So grateful to meet with the incredible team at Resilience1220 & hear more about the lifesaving support they provide for young people in Evergreen. 

Thanks to critical legislation I helped pass in the CO legislature, we’ve made real progress in increasing access to mental health care. 

But all of that progress is at risk as Trump guts the very services that have been transformative. If you are struggling, know you are never alone and you can call 988 for help.

We stopped by numerous small businesses on main street in Golden to discuss the impact of Trump’s trade war on their ability to plan for the future and the impact on their bottom line. Our small businesses need predictability. They can’t plan for what’s going to happen tomorrow, let alone the next year.

Big corporations are in a better position to weather the storm but it’s our small businesses & families that will be hit the hardest. These are just a few of the stories from our short walk around Main Street.

I will continue to fight to reign in Trump’s abuse of power and stand with our community’s small businesses.

Happy Labor Day! Today we honor the workers who keep our country running - from teachers and nurses to service workers and first responders. Your hard work and dedication make our communities stronger and safer every day.

But fair wages, safe workplaces, & the rights of workers are far from guaranteed. As I head back to DC after working for a month in our beautiful district, I’m bringing the voices of Colorado workers with me who are terrified about what the future holds after the passage of the OBBB, but they are also resilient and ready for the fight ahead.

Trump’s cuts to Medicaid, SNAP, and other programs under the Big Ugly Law will impact families across CO.

But it’s places like Evergreen Christian Outreach that give me hope that we will be able to get through this together. They provide a lifeline for our neighbors in need – food, financial help, mental health support, shelter and transitional housing - even as demand has doubled since the pandemic. 

Their work shows the true power of community. Times are tough with rising costs and it’s going to get a lot harder – but we are going to weather the storm together.

Being out in the district & talking about the impacts coming our way has been heavy & challenging, it’s people like the leaders of the @theactionctr  who bring me hope about the future. They’re working to utilize a public school building that is no longer open to serve our community in a different way & reimagine what’s possible.

From meals and clothing to behavioral health care and other vital services, this new site will be a true one-stop resource for neighbors in need. Their project is going through the process of approval, but I’m so inspired by people like this who are stepping up in such a critical time.

62 years ago, thousands of Americans took to the streets in Washington & demanded our country make good on our fundamental promise of liberty & justice for all. Their footsteps & voices have changed the course of history – not just here in America, but across the world. 

Today, we know that march never really ended, especially as Trump threatens to erase all the progress we've made. I know that we owe it to the next generation to keep marching, keep peacefully protesting, and keep speaking out, because we've still got more work to do until everyone can fully share in that promise of freedom, equality, & justice.

I left lunch this week at @GirlsIncDenver so inspired by the amazing girls & women I met 💖

As a woman in politics, I’ve often felt overlooked and underestimated, so it meant a lot to share what it’s like being a mom in Congress, the barriers women and girls still face, & the power we have when we lift each other up.

This organization is changing lives by reminding every girl from Lakewood to East Denver that she can accomplish anything she dreams of.

Thanks to Pioneer Energy for inviting us to learn more about the challenges they're facing getting answers & securing federal grants they rely on for responsible energy production. 

Since Trump was sworn in, hundreds of millions of dollars in grant funding have been withheld from organizations across CO, including Pioneer.

I'll always fight to support the innovative work of businesses like this one, & ensure they're able access the federal dollars they need to continue their work. Their cutting-edge carbon capture technology is helping reduce harmful emissions & move us toward a cleaner, more sustainable future.

So grateful to visit with the health care providers & patients at @stridechc in Wheat Ridge to learn about the basic care they provide for families who need it most in our community. 

But because of Trump, many will be forced out of the care they need. I’m working with local providers like STRIDE to highlight how essential these services are – our federal dollars should be going to the families who need support most, not more billionaires.

Many in our community are terrified about the proposed budget cuts — not just to HUD, but across the board — and what they could mean for themselves and the 200,000+ Coloradans who rely on these programs to keep a roof over their heads. Survivors of domestic violence and their families could lose access to safe housing and life-saving services, forcing many to stay in unsafe situations or risk homelessness.

Thank you Family Tree Inc for hosting us alongside Foothills Regional Housing, Metro West Housing Solutions, @porchlightfjc,  @cocoalition & @firstdaofco to discuss the critical work supporting our communities.  These organizations are already stretched thin, and cuts would make it even harder for people facing dire circumstances to get the support they need. We're fighting back because families deserve better.

Heartbreaking doesn’t even do it justice. I’m devastated to learn of yet another school shooting in Minneapolis.

Like so many moms, I just dropped my son, Davis, off for his first full week of school. I can’t imagine the pain of parents who will never see their children come home again. No family should have to endure this heartbreak & no child should have to go to school wondering if it’s safe.

I'm tired of being told this is normal - and you should be too. Thoughts & prayers aren't going to do anything to fix this.

But we're not going to stop fighting to have our voices heard & our stories told.

Like so many young women, I’ve been underestimated & overlooked my whole life.

And even in the face of uncertainty under the Trump administration, I’ll keep showing up everyday to fight for equality — because women deserve to lead, to be heard, & to have a government that truly reflects us. (3/3)

Earlier this year, I gave birth to my son, Sam, & was denied the ability to vote remotely.

I wasn't allowed to do my job simply because I had a baby - this type of antiquated thinking is part of what prevents women from having a seat at the table & upholds the status quo. (2/3)

Today, is Women's Equality Day! 105 years ago, women were officially granted the right to vote.

It's been over a century but I often think about how places like Congress aren't built for women. I know we've got a long way to go until we actually reach equality for everyone.🧵 (1/3)

I joined my colleague & fellow mom @RepPressley to make sure the needs of babies are prioritized as we demand additional action from @SecRubio. 

While we welcome the steps being taken to get more aid into Gaza, the US, UN, & Israel must work together to urgently prioritize baby formula, alongside other critical aid.

As a mom, I can’t fathom the desperation parents are facing trying to feed their babies & kids as this tragic war continues. It’s going to take collaboration from all parties & every minute counts.

We're already feeling the ramifications of Trump's Big Ugly Bill here in CO.
